definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to link/to join/to connect/continuously/in succession/including/(used with 也[ye3], 都[dou1] etc) even/company (military)

sentences.english: Looking at the artistic creations of Pan Li-hong gave rise to a series of thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 看了潘麗紅的美術創作，引發一連串的思考。

sentences.english: This cluster of record-breaking events could be merely an streak of bad luck.
sentences.chinese: 這一連串破紀錄的事件也許只是一連串的黴運。

sentences.english: This cluster of record-breaking events could be merely an streak of bad luck.
sentences.chinese: 這一連串破紀錄的事件也許只是一連串的黴運。

sentences.english: Black-tie dinners and champagne parties were being held in the capitals of Europe.
sentences.chinese: 歐洲各國首都則舉行了一連串正式慶祝晚宴。

sentences.english: Uncle Sam entertains/amuses the children for hours at a time.
sentences.chinese: 薩姆叔叔一連好幾小時地逗孩子們樂。

sentences.english: Ben had it out with his roommate about coming back home so late and making a lot of noise.
sentences.chinese: 是有深夜遲歸引起一連串噪音，班因而與他起了口角。

sentences.english: The co-workers submitted a laundry list of complaints to the committee.
sentences.chinese: 員工向委員會提出一連串的抱怨。

sentences.english: English isn't just a list of English words.
sentences.chinese: 學習英語並非僅是死記一連串的單字。

sentences.english: Children ask a seemingly never-ending stream of questions from an early age.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們從很小時就開始問一連串似乎永無止境的問題。

sentences.english: She droned away for hours about her pet subjects.
sentences.chinese: 她對她所喜歡的話題一連嘮叨了幾個小時。

sentences.english: Bad days generally occur when a number of little frustrations happen in succession.
sentences.chinese: 糟糕的日子通常出現於當一連串小挫折連續發生時。

sentences.english: This article has over twenty exclamatory sentences in a row.
sentences.chinese: 這篇文章一連用了二十多個感嘆句。

sentences.english: Then there was a famine in the days of David three years, year after year; and David enquired of the LORD.
sentences.chinese: 大衛年間有饑荒，一連三年，大衛就求問耶和華。

sentences.english: Lin Ch'ung stayed with Ch'ai Chin in the village for several days and was entertained by Ch'ai Chin every day.
sentences.chinese: 柴進留林沖在莊上一連住了幾日，每日好酒好食相待。

sentences.english: A series of explosions had rocked the Taj Mahal only despite midnight.
sentences.chinese: 子夜後，泰姬瑪哈大酒店響起了一連串的爆炸聲。

sentences.english: The list ended up with sweetbreads.
sentences.chinese: 那一連串菜單的最後一道是牛雜碎。

definition: (to be done) by (a certain date)/lasting (a certain time)
the curtain falls/lower the curtain/to come to an end (of a meeting)
to go on stage/fig. to appear on the scene/used in advertising to mean new product
the scene (of a crime, accident etc)/(on) the spot/(at) the site
to exercise/to move about/to operate/to use connections (personal influence)/loose/shaky/active/movable/activity/campaign/maneuver/behavior/CL:項|项[xiang4],個|个[ge4]
